com.lithium.community.android.manager

Class LiSDKManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lithium.community.android.manager.LiSDKManager

  • public final class LiSDKManager
extends java.lang.Object

    Interface to Lithium Community Android SDK. Provides the entry point into the Community REST API v2 using OAuth2.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(android.content.Context context,
                              LiAppCredentials credentials)
                       throws LiInitializationException
        Initializes the SDK. If the initialization is successful getInstance() will return an initialized SDK Manager. This function may or may not create a new instance or reinitialize the SDK Manager with subsequent calls.
        Parameters:
        context - The android Context to be used by the SDK.
        credentials - The LiAppCredentials for authenticating the SDK.
        Throws:
        LiInitializationException

      • init

        @Deprecated
public static LiSDKManager init(android.content.Context context,
                                            LiAppCredentials credentials)
        Deprecated. Use initialize(Context, LiAppCredentials) instead.
        Initializes Lia SDK Manager.
        Parameters:
        context - The android context.
        credentials - The credentials for authentication.
        Returns:
        An instance of Li SDK Manager

      • isInitialized

        public static boolean isInitialized()
        To check if the the SDK is initialized correctly. Should be used before invoking APIs of the SDK or components which depend on it.
        Returns:
        true iff SDK is fully initialized, otherwise false.

      • isEnvironmentInitialized

        @Deprecated
public static boolean isEnvironmentInitialized()
        Deprecated. Use isInitialized() instead.
        Checks whether the SDK is initialized.
        Returns:
        true or false depending on whether the SDK is initialized

      • getInstance

        public static LiSDKManager getInstance()
        Returns an instance of the LiSDKManager.
        Returns:
        if the SDK initialized then the current instance of LiSDKManager is return, else null is returned.

      • syncWithCommunity

        public void syncWithCommunity(android.content.Context context)
        This method is used to pull configurations from the community and update the local configurations.
        Parameters:
        context - The android context.

      • initLoginFlow

        public void initLoginFlow(android.content.Context context,
                          java.lang.String ssoToken,
                          LiDeviceTokenProvider deviceTokenProvider)
        Start SSO login.
        Parameters:
        context - An Android context.
        ssoToken - Single SignOn token if the community uses its own identity provider.
        deviceTokenProvider - Provider to get the device ID for push notifications. A Firebase or GCM token.

      • initLoginFlow

                          java.lang.String ssoToken)
                   throws java.net.URISyntaxException

        Parameters:
        context - An Android context.
        ssoToken - Single SignOn token if the community uses its own identity provider.

                           throws LiRestResponseException

        Parameters:
        context - An Android context.
        callBack - LiAuthService.FreshTokenCallBack
        Throws:
        LiRestResponseException - An exception is thrown when an invalid response is received by the SDK.

      • getNeedsTokenRefresh

        public boolean getNeedsTokenRefresh()
        Checks if the SDK needs to refresh the access token.
        Returns:
        true if the access token has expired or user is logged out, otherwise false.
